description:
Two months ago, I started work on voter.wtf. I wanted to create speedy, vote-with-reason-focused governance client for Nouns. 30k+ lines of code later, it is minimally fully featured and well loved.

voter.wtf has pioneered several unique features

Homepage features a timeline of all votes across proposals.
Proposal pages feature side by side FOR and AGAINST votes, for easy comparison and context setting.
Votes can be "liked" via web3 wallet signature.
Non delegates, in addition to delegates, can vote on any proposal.
At glance view of which props you have voted on and which you still need to.
reVoteWithReason: quickly vote with reason by quoting someone else's reason in your vote.
(Twitter roundup of these features, with images)
The code is open source and under MIT license. The site currently has no cost overhead: it runs on Vercel free tier and only relies on the Nouns DAO subgraph.

project.name: voter.wtf
project.description: A speedy, vote-with-reason-focused governance client for Nouns DAO.

title: Retro Fund Voter.wtf
